waves.Q_wave: Small Q waves in leads V5-V6 (normal septal Q waves)
waves.T_wave: Biphasic T waves in leads V2-V4, suggestive of ischemia

segments.ST_segment: ST depression of 1-2 mm in leads II, III, aVF, V4-V6

findings: ST segment depression in inferior and lateral leads
Biphasic T waves in precordial leads V2-V4
impression: Abnormal ECG. ST segment depression and T wave changes consistent with acute coronary syndrome (NSTEMI). Recommend urgent cardiology evaluation and cardiac catheterization.
comparison: No prior ECG available for comparison
clinical_correlation: ECG findings correlated with elevated troponin and clinical presentation of chest pain. Patient underwent emergent cardiac catheterization.
